alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North Itasca; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:32PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Itasca and west central St. Louis Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 332 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Marcell, or 17 miles north of Grand Rapids, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Itasca and west central St. Louis Counties, including the following locations... Buck Lake, Side Lake, Snake Trail, Stony Brook, Perch Lake, Gunn Lake, Balsam Lake, Stingy Lake, Wabana Lake and Spider Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North Itasca; South Itasca
